explanations.A: It looks like you have just multiplied by 1000. Remember there are 60 minutes in an hour and 60 seconds in a minute.
explanations.B: There are 60 minutes in an hour and 60 seconds in a minute. 3 hours × 60 = 180 minutes. 180 minutes × 60 = 10,800 seconds.
explanations.C: This is the number of minutes. What can you do next to find the number of seconds?
explanations.D: It looks like you have just multiplied by 100. Remember there are 60 minutes in an hour and 60 seconds in a minute.

explanations.A: This is the number of minutes. What can you do next to find the number of seconds?
explanations.B: It looks like you have just multiplied by 100. Remember there are 60 minutes in an hour and 60 seconds in a minute.
explanations.C: It looks like you have just multiplied by 1000. Remember there are 60 minutes in an hour and 60 seconds in a minute.
explanations.D: There are 60 minutes in an hour and 60 seconds in a minute. 10 hours × 60 = 600 minutes. 600 minutes × 60 = 36,000 seconds.

explanations.A: This is the number of minutes in a day. What can you do next to find the number of seconds?
explanations.B: We multiply 1 day by 24 to find the hours, then 60 to find the minutes, then 60 again to find the seconds. That gives 60 × 60 × 24
explanations.C: Remember there are 24 hours in a day, 60 minutes in an hour and 60 seconds in a minute.
explanations.D: Remember there are 24 hours in a day, not 12.

explanations.A: Remember there are 24 hours in a day, 60 minutes in an hour and 60 seconds in a minute.
explanations.B: Remember there are 24 hours in a day, not 12.
explanations.C: This is the number of minutes in 2 days. What can you do next to find the number of seconds?
explanations.D: We multiply 2 days by 24 to find the hours, then 60 to find the minutes, then 60 again to find the seconds. That gives 2 × 60 × 60 × 24

explanations.A: This would mean there were only 10 hours in a day. Think about a clock, how many hours are there during a whole day?
explanations.B: This is the number of hours in 1 day. How many are in two days?
explanations.C: This would mean there were only 20 hours in a day. Think about a clock, how many hours are there during a whole day?
explanations.D: There are 24 hours in a day. 2 × 24 = 48

explanations.A: This would mean there were only 20 hours in a day. Think about a clock, how many hours are there during a whole day?
explanations.B: There are 24 hours in a day. 4 × 24 = 96
explanations.C: This would mean there were only 10 hours in a day. Think about a clock, how many hours are there during a whole day?
explanations.D: This would mean there were only 12 hours in a day. Think about a clock, how many hours are there during a whole day?

explanations.A: This is the number of hours in 5 days. We need the number in 5 weeks.
explanations.B: Not quite. How many hours are in each day? There are more than 12.
explanations.C: Not quite. How many days are in each week? There are more than 5.
explanations.D: There are 7 days in each week. and 24 hours in each day. So in 5 weeks we have 5 × 7 × 24 hours

explanations.A: Not quite. How many days are in each week? There are more than 5.
explanations.B: There are 7 days in each week. and 24 hours in each day. So in 10 weeks we have 10 × 7 × 24 hours
explanations.C: This is the number of hours in 10 days. We need the number in 10 weeks.
explanations.D: Not quite. How many hours are in each day? There are more than 12.

explanations.A: This is the number of days in 2 years rather than a leap year.
explanations.B: A normal year has 365 days. A leap year has one extra day - February 29th, so 366 days in total.
explanations.C: Remember in a leap year we have an extra day - February 29th.
explanations.D: This is the number of days in a normal year. Remember in a leap year we have an extra day - February 29th.

explanations.A: Not quite. Remember in a leap year we have an extra day - February 29th.
explanations.B: This is the number of days in 2 normal years rather than 2 leap years.
explanations.C: This is the number of days in 1 leap year. How many are in two leap years.
explanations.D: A normal year has 365 days. A leap year has 366 days. 2 leap years would have 2 × 366 = 732
